content: in a court case the defendant was ordered to pay €1092 in procedural costs the case lasted three months and the court made a final decision the document explains that a default judgment was made to satisfy a claim on the assets of a deceased person the joint ownership of an apartment property will be terminated and the property will be sold at an auction the sale amount will be divided between the parties involved the defendants are also ordered to pay the procedural costs the document mentions the possibility of filing an appeal and the payment of state fees it explains the process for requesting procedural aid and the deadline for compliance the judgment is based on the division of the assets the claimant has permission to distribute the assets and has proposed selling the apartment property jointly the defendants have responded to the proposal the document concludes with details about the sale of the property and the division of the sale amount among the defendants the court has ordered the defendants to respond to the request for payment of procedural costs one defendant has responded to the lawsuit and the other has responded to the claim since the defendants did not respond within the deadline the court has made a default judgment to satisfy the lawsuit the court has determined the amount of procedural costs that the defendants must pay the claimant is also asking for the payment of state fees and the representatives salary the total amount of costs for the proceedings is €1092 the court will determine how these costs will be divided the supreme court has clarified that the representatives time and hourly rate must be assessed separately the court will assess if the time spent on preparation was reasonable and may reduce costs if unnecessary actions were taken in this case it is a civil dispute over assets the claimants representative meets the requirements set forth in the civil procedure code the court has determined that the hourly fee of €160 is justified the state fee must also be paid and the claimant has already paid it the document explains that the allocation of costs can be contested and appealed this summary provides a clear explanation of the different steps in the case without mentioning the names of the parties involved the original text refers to specific articles of the legal code
